data.title: The best!
data.text: Hands down these have to be the best donuts I have ever eaten! Their apple fritters are amazing as well! Never eaten a bad item here. Tip - always check to see what they have in the rack. There may be a fresh donut not in the case that you can score too!

data.title: Fresh donuts
data.text: Fun and tasty donut shop in downtown Hampton. They have both yeast and cake style donuts, glazed or decorated, filled or not. The donuts are oversized compared to our local Krispy Kreme and Dunkin' Donuts, which is a plus because they are sooo good. I ordered two, and am a bit too full. Fast friendly staff, really good local brand of coffee, lots of seating options. They also have fresh biscuits, biscuit sandwiches and bagels. The sign says that if they are lucky enough to sell out they close early, so if it is getting close to the posted closing time, I'd give them a call.

data.title: Always Fresh;
data.text: When the doughnuts made that morning are sold, they close for the day.  We watch our sugar/pastry/desert intake. So, when we decide we want a treat, we want it fresh.  These are fresh!

data.title: BACON!
data.text:
Cool little joint in downtown Hampton.  Donuts are made in the early morning and once they sell out they close....from what I understand.  Donuts are fresh and delicious...
I tried the bacon donut and it was yummy.  Coffee is good as well but don't expect cappuccino or expresso....Will be back soon

data.title: O M G ! ! N
data.text: These doughnuts are absolutely freaking amazing !!!!!  Made greasy every morning like little round puffs fro heaven !!!!

data.title: Wow!
data.text: Delectable and exquisite donuts! I recommend the pumpkin. It was moist inside and crunchy on the outside. The glazed is also among the best I've tried. The dubstep music adds a cool element to this colorful place!

data.title: Good donuts but great coffee
data.text: Was looking for good coffee place in Hampton and found this place on Yelp.  Donuts were tasty, but it was the coffee that kept me coming back.  Iced coffee with a coffee cube in the center kept  my drink cool and it didn't get watered down.  They use a local roasting company so the brew was really good.  Open early and they close when they sell out of donuts so check before going!

data.title: Yay!!!
data.text: This place is a hidden gem in Hampton.  Very nice staff. Waited patiently while my daughter made her selections and offered suggestions. Beautiful seating area we will eat there in the future. Plenty of parking. The doughnuts had the largest selection I have ever seen and all the ones I tried were perfect. I will be frequenting this bakery with out a doubt.

data.title: Pleasant Surprise!
data.text: Just happened to find a listing when doing a search.  I didn't even know they were there! They have a big variety that makes it hard to chose. Maple glazed was awesome.  I will definitely be going back.

data.title: Sooo good
data.text: Been here numerous times and each time is a better experience. Twice we made the drive to find out they were out of yeast donuts. The cake donuts are good, but we like the yeast donuts, especially the Bowties!

data.title: Oh yeah
data.text: Got an assorted dozen for $17 and don't know what half of the donuts are but I do know they are delicious! Even the plain old fashioned is good. The glazed cake with pink and brown stripes, strawberry filled with chocolate glaze, blueberry cake with maple bacon glaze were all great and I would get them again. The cream filled with powdered sugar on top was super sweet and boring, meant to get the one with strawberry filling. Some of the donuts are labeled but most are not, others ordering knew specific names of donuts and I think you can call ahead for popular flavors. Some were gone already at 8 (they open at 7 on Saturday) like lemon and maple bacon with apple filling. There is a drive up window. There were only 2 people in line in front of me and 2 people filling orders. It is bigger inside than I thought it would be, with several tables.

data.title: OH how sweet it is....
data.text: Get there early, get your favorite, and try something new. Always fresh and of course always a great way to start a sugar high.

data.title: And I thought Krispy Kreme was good!
data.text: OMG! These donuts are SOO good! I have to restrain myself every time I drive by or I'd be big as a house. I'm more of traditionalist; my favorites are the basic glazed, the cinnamon sugar and the eclairs. If you want to try them, go early for the best selection. That said, if you're looking for specifics let them know and they're pretty accommodating.

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: What a neat little place! These donuts are AMAZING! Was on vacation and took a box home to NY with me. My favorite was the Smores one. All the donuts are made fresh.  I was able to catch a peek in the kitchen while they were making fritters and it smelled amazing!!! They're only open until they sell out so get there bright and early!

data.title: go early for the variety
data.text: this family business is becoming  local favorite. I enjoy the variety and freshness of pastries and doughnuts. it's small but they turn over people and service quickly. It reminds me of family shops in the metro NYC area.  I like the maple bacon Doughnut and the red velvet ones with icing.

data.title: Very good, but very expensive
data.text: If you don't get there very early (sometimes that means 7:30) you may not get the best they have.  They are very good, but the few that I would consider great have only been available after that early hour very few times.  $17 a dozen is a whole lot to pay if all they have available is what the early birds didn't want (like the ones with cereal sprinkled on top).  I was very eager to support a local small business, but it's time for them to up their game, or lower their prices. (And btw - is it really too hard to label the trays so people can figure out what kind of donuts they are?  Several times even the workers had to guess.)

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: The doughnuts are excellent and the staff is friendly. I've been there several times and have always had a great experience there.

data.title: Temptations everywhere
data.text: Decadent donuts everywhere you turn.  Have to get there early, they usually sell out quickly. Always tasty, have some specialties including bacon, chicken, and crab meat (that's 3 donuts, not 1).  Friendly staff, downtown Hampton.

data.title: Amazing Donuts!
data.text: Best donuts in Hampton, hands down!  They sell of their famous glazed donuts quick so get there by 10am (or call ahead and have them set some aside for you!)

data.title: Out of the limelight but worth the visit.
data.text: Glazed donuts sits directly behind LaBodega in the back of once was a drive through of a bank. There donuts and breads are all freshly made and delish! You can't go wrong trying any one.
